posts.name: Cast Iron Kitchen
posts.note: Cast Iron Kitchen serves North Carolina Based Southern Cuisine, seasonal and locally driven menu for brunch and breakfast is served all day. They have crafted cocktails and the boat or beach picnic packages. You should order the Not Your Momma’s Meatloaf sandwich or the shrimp and grits or chicken and waffles.

posts.name: Fork N’ Cork
posts.note: Fork N’ Cork serves gourmet burgers, sandwiches, and appetizers are on the menu at this quaint, brick-walled bar with TVs. You should order the duck wings or their burgers or the patty melt or the Wellington bites that have port wine cherry sauce.

posts.name: Something Fishy Seafood
posts.note: Something Fishy Seafood is a down-home seafood shack dishing up generous servings of clams, shrimp, and more in old-school digs. You need to order the seafood platter which has seven types of fried seafood items which probably could feed two people or more.

posts.name: Sweet n Savory Cafe
posts.note: Sweet n Savory Cafe has bright murals which adorn this cheery cafe with all-day American eats, an on-site bakery, and outdoor seats. You should order the Wrightsville Beach French Toast two thick slices of cinnamon raisin bread dunked in their house batter and fried to perfection with strawberries and blueberries with whip cream or the Mutha Heffer which is their meatloaf sandwich with candied bacon, onion straws, tomato jam, dijonnaise, arugula on texas toast.
